definition: too polite/overcourteous
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
gift/rite/ceremony/CL:份[fen4]/propriety/etiquette/courtesy
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: How kind of you to say so.

definition: to stand on ceremony/punctilious
(formal) you may dispense with curtseying
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to regard sb as an outsider
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
(old) to stand up (after kowtowing)/You may rise.
to not deserve (one's good fortune etc)
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
to salute/to greet
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
worthy little brother
there is no harm in saying what one thinks (idiom)
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
trivial matter/trifle
